flawed_nl_solution:
If in six years Xavier will be 30 years old, he is 30-6 = <<30-6=42>>42 years old now.
If Xavier is twice as old as Yasmin, Yasmin is 42/2 = <<42/2=21>>21 years old.
The total of their ages now is 21+42 = <<21+42=63>>63 years
#### 63

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 24, not 42. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
